Use the diagram to determine their coordinates and then answer the questions.

generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

First, we read the coordinates from the graph:

  • Point \(A\) is at ({@ax@}, {@ay@}).
  • Point \(B\) is at ({@bx@}, {@by@}).

(a) & (b) Position Vectors:

The position vector is simply the coordinates written as a column vector:

\( \vec{OA} = \begin{pmatrix} {@ax@} \\ {@ay@} \end{pmatrix}, \quad \vec{OB} = \begin{pmatrix} {@bx@} \\ {@by@} \end{pmatrix} \)

(c) Displacement Vector:

To find the vector from \(A\) to \(B\), we subtract the start position from the end position:

\( \vec{AB} = \vec{OB} - \vec{OA} = \begin{pmatrix} {@bx@} \\ {@by@} \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} {@ax@} \\ {@ay@} \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} {@vec_ab_x@} \\ {@vec_ab_y@} \end{pmatrix} \)
